intro: Lippia scirpea, commonly known as swamp lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its erect, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple, which bloom during the warmer months. Lippia scirpea thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to waterlogged soils, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
